habitat_description:
Northwest:
Microtus townsendii is found from sea level to approximately 1830 meters in the Olympic Mts. Of Washington and are inhabitants of wet meadows and marshes with dense grass and sedge cover, apparently avoiding forest and dense brush (Wilson and Ruff 1999). They are good swimmers capable of crossing small streams and often occupy shalllowly flooded areas during wet winters (Wilson and Ruff 1999). Diets consist of Juncus, horsetail, clover, and numerous grass species.
